name: Ban's Diving Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at Bans diving resort and had a horrible stay.
reviews.title: Blood sucking parasite horror!!!!
Great loaction - but look around 1st if ur not diving
reviews.text: We chose the accommodation because the rooms seemed clean, modern, spacious, with TV, fridge, a/c. The gardens were well designed and manicured, the pool clean and big. Location in the heart of Sairee was good.
When we went to bed we noticed a few small brown beetles in the bed and around the room. We removed as many as we could find and weren't too concerned.
reviews.title: Simple but good value!
Adequate Hotel, But Definitely Not a Resort
reviews.text: When i woke up i noticed a tiny red beetle on my pillow, i went to kill it and it exploded with blood. I slowly sat up and noticed my pillow and sheets were covered in blood explosions where i had rolled over them in the night, as well as plenty of living red beetles in the bed. I was absolutely horrified.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay here because it looked very good at first sight. Unfortunately, there turned out to be many drawbacks:
reviews.title: Not very positive: noise, cleanliness, unfriendly staff -> only for diving teens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Dirty bed : we took the better roomtype of 2000 baht (got it for 1800 because i did a couple of dives). Paying 1800 baht makes you expect clean beds, but ours was full of stains (the cotton was even hard/stiff). At first we thought the sheets were just a bit worn down, but upon closer examination, on our second day, the stains turned out to be semen stains. So we'd be sleeping in a dirty bed. It took us some talking to the staff to get it cleaned. The staff was unfriendly. No sorry, no excuses, nothing..
reviews.title: Very unfriendly staff

reviews.text: - noise: the noise from the open air bar was really really loud. And I am even a techno / loud music lover... It went on until around 0:30 at night, so we weren't too happy about that
reviews.title: Diving only

reviews.text: - overcharging: the staff tried to overcharge us when buying the boat tickets for the way back to Samui
reviews.title: Banns - good place to dive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted somewhere that was on the beach and had a pool and where we could dive so Ban's ticked all of the boxes.
reviews.title: Good value in Ko Tao

likes.liked: — The laid back atmosphere right on the beach

reviews.text: I'm surprised with all the negative reviews of Ban's. My experience with Bans was similar to all my other experiences in the south of Thailand. The people there are tired of tourists and they are rude and disinterested. Ban's is no exception - and no worse than anywhere else I stayed. While at Ban's, I stayed in a budget room that was clean and acceptable for the price (1/2 off since I was in the diving school). I think the more expensive rooms are closer to the beach and bar and, therefore, are more noisy!
reviews.title: Acceptable - great instructor!
One of the worst experiences of my life
reviews.text: In my experience the hotel staff was acceptable, but certainly not accommodating. The real problem I had was at the restaurant. It was totally unacceptable!!!! The food was marginal and you honestly had to beg to get a menu or to get anyone to help you. If you managed to order, it might take 5 minutes to get your food, or it might take 1 hour. I quit eating there after my second day -- but found several of the competing restaurants to be almost as bad.

Having said all that, my experience with the dive school was very good. I had the best instructor imaginable - his name was Ronan and he was Israeli. He was fantastic!! My dives were not overcrowded and Ronan did a very good job of maximizing our time in the water and our experience while underwater.
reviews.title: Noisy 'till 2am

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Koh Tao, generally, is very popular as a European backpacker destination. It has cheap accommodations, very cheap diving schools and lots of drinking and having fun. If that's not what you are into, I would strongly recommend trying someplace else. I'm only 36 yrs old and I felt like an old man there :-) Of course, if you have any aversion to thousands of <25 backpacker-types, I would avoid Thailand all-together!!
reviews.title: Only stay here if you're young and diving

likes.liked: — Gorgeous landscaping, nice room, knowledgeable diving instructors
likes.disliked: — Unhelpful staff, lots of young partiers (

reviews.text: Overall Koh Tau is a wonderful place but choose where to stay and/or dive very carefully. I stayed at Ban's for 2 months to complete a Divemaster course & I found the staff here to be extremely obnoxious, arrogant & very, very rude, both the Thais and the western diving instructors. Ban's completely ruined my experience of Koh Tau to be fair. I've never been as badly treated nor spoken to in such a rude manner anywhere else. Horrible place & people.
reviews.title: Do not stay or dive here unless.....

description: Ban's Technical Diving is operated out of Ban's Diving, Koh Tao, Thailand. Ban's Technical Diving is an award winning DSAT, BSAC, ANDI Technical Instructor Diving Facility. The only Tech Center on Koh Tao (and one of few in the world) that offers DSAT Technical Diving Intructor Courses. Deep Wreck Diving, Cave Expeditions.-Nitrox, Deep, Wreck, Gas Blender, Compressor Operator, Rebreather, Equipment, Emergency Oxygen, Technical Decompression Diving, Cave, Cavern.........
